did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences collection on Elisha Kent Kane

bioghist.p: Elisha Kent Kane (1820-1857) was a naval officer, physician, and explorer. He served as senior medical officer on the First Grinnell expedition to the Arctic and organized and commanded the Second Grinnell expedition. He was elected to the Academy of Natural Sciences in 1843, before his arctic explorations. Kane gave the specimens of birds, mammals, and plants that he collected on these voyages to the Academy.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of correspondence related to the legacy of Elisha Kent Kane. The correspondence includes letters of endorsement from 1955 for Elisha Kent Kane's candidacy to be inducted into New York University's Hall of Fame; a 1926 letter to the Academy offering for sale a bust of Elisha Kent Kane, and the Academy's letter declining the offer; and a 1962 letter to the Academy offering for sale a portfolio of Kane memorabilia, including etchings and specimens from his Arctic exploration.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
